text.p: These are the leading stories in the Mozambican press on Wednesday.
Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.

- People found with pots or other articles made out of copper, aluminium or other materials used in the electricity industry will be tried for theft unless they can prove the articles were legitimately obtained, if a proposal presented in Mozambique's parliament on Tuesday is approved. Thieves have stolen more than 300 km of cable in Mozambique since 1995.

- Mozambican police have discovered military radio communications equipment in a house at Zitundo, 10 km from the South African border. The equipment was in current use but the identity of the owner has not been revealed.
